page.title: 10ROYAL CHARTER MOELFRE 3
page.content: A member of the diving team came to school to discuss The Royal Charter. We saw some underwater slides of their work and some artefacts. Some artefacts were encrusted in marine life. They had to be kept in water or they would fall apart. They are convinced that they will find gold bars, Australian & British sovereigns & the ship's engine. The engine is very valuable and was built in Greenwich.They hope to find several cannons and valuable wine like that sold at Sotheby's for Â£250,000. They have no intention of bringing up the ship because of the expense. The R.Ch did not break up in the storm as books claim.It was broken up during later salvaging attempts. David Mathews and Carey Lambert.
